com.tabuto.jenetic
Class Dna

java.lang.Object
  com.tabuto.jenetic.Dna
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Dna
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Class Dna

Dna is a class that represent a simple model of DNA as a Gene Vector. Add a Gene into Dna is simple by using the add(Gene) ,add(double) add(boolean) methods. So the Dna is just a information's object container, able to save or load itself using an XML file thanks to methods save(String) and load(String) Dna class also provides a merge(Dna) method simulating the Dna Genetic Recombination. During this process it's possible introduce some "noise" using the param variable.

Version:
0.2.3
Author:
tabuto83
See Also:
Gene, Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

DNA

protected java.util.Vector<Gene> DNA
The Vector Gene is a dinamic array where Gene are stored

param

protected double param
This variable represent the percent of mutation introduced by merge(Dna) method. The param value should be between 0 and 1. Default value is 0;

See Also:
merge(Dna), merge(Dna, Dna)

private java.lang.String Name
The name of this DNA

merge

public Dna merge(Dna otherDna)
This method merge this Dna with other and return a new Dna Code. This method add some random error, if param is not equals to zero, in the merging process in order to simulate a genetic mutation;

Parameters:
otherDna -
Returns:
new Dna

                        Dna secondDna)

Returns:
new merged Dna

loadXML

public void loadXML(java.lang.String fileName)
Deprecated. Use static method load(String)

Load a list of Genes from an XML file previously saved using save(String) Can't load Gene containing not primitive objects!!

Parameters:
String - fileName

load

public static Dna load(java.lang.String filename)
Static method returns a previusly saved Dna. Dna file must be a previusly saved .dna file extension

Parameters:
filename - file name
Returns:
a file loaded Dna
See Also:
Dna#save(String)}

save

public void save(java.lang.String filename)
Save a copy of DNA object in a binary file with .dna extension. It can be load using the following code: 
  Dna MyNewDna = null;
  FileInputStream fis = null;
  ObjectInputStream in = null;
  try
     {
     fis = new FileInputStream(filename);
     in = new ObjectInputStream(fis);
     MyNewDna = (Dna)in.readObject();
     in.close();
     }
     catch(IOException ex)
     {
     ex.printStackTrace();
     }
     catch(ClassNotFoundException ex)
     {
     ex.printStackTrace();
     }

Parameters:
filename -
